sentence.text: When they misbehave , we resort to various sanctions , including old-fashioned spanking at times .
Owen : It 's agreed then people who misbehave and cause the teacher to waste time must pay it back at break .
But it is a safe bet that the current owners will not sell if the French insurer misbehaves .
He disliked his Bible class of teenage boys because they misbehaved , but at times it was happy .
The evening was quite riotous , with Mallachy and Rory misbehaving badly enough ( in Karen 's English opinion ) to be thrown out .
Cockney dads were in form , threatening their kids with the belt if they misbehaved .
My brother and I would be misbehaving noisily .
When a cat misbehaves and its owner reacts crossly , the cat feels threatened .
If your dog persists in misbehaving when the doorbell is rung , then you may have to take alternative action .
Children misbehave when they are discouraged and believe they can not succeed by useful means .
One or other of them drafted a statement which was a flat denial that he had misbehaved either sexually or politically .
I 'm sick of the way you 've treated me , as if I were a child who 's misbehaved . "
She reluctantly held out her hand , palm upwards , and felt like a naughty schoolgirl who 'd misbehaved in class .
He disliked the work at the boys club because the teenagers misbehaved , and because he could see no use in the work .
All he seems to do is make sure that players do n't misbehave and if they do , he is there to reprimand them .
At least when a guest is misbehaving they 're where we expect them to be .
